org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity

Class AbstractActivity<ConfigType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.annotation.AbstractAnnotatedThing<Activity<?>>
      • org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity.AbstractActivity<ConfigType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ConfigType - type of configuration object to be used to hold configuration information
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Annotated<Activity<?>>, Configurable<ConfigType>, Activity<ConfigType>, WorkflowItem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAsynchronousActivity

    public abstract class AbstractActivity<ConfigType>
extends AbstractAnnotatedThing<Activity<?>>
implements Activity<ConfigType>
    Convenience abstract superclass for generic Activity instances. Parameterised on the configuration type used by the Activity implementation - when this object is serialised the getConfiguration method is used to store specific details of the activity, this is then used immediately after a call to the default constructor when deserialising from XML on a workflow load.

    This class holds port sets and mappings, and returns references directly to them rather than copies thereof.

    If you're writing an abstract activity (one that cannot be directly invoked) you should extend this class for convenience. This can be useful when you wish to specify some kind of abstract definition of a process which will be bound at workflow invocation time to a particular concrete activity through the action of a custom dispatch stack layer (which you will also provide)

    Author:
    Tom Oinn, Stuart Owen

      • getConfiguration

        public abstract ConfigType getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Each item stores configuration within a bean of type ConfigurationType, this method returns the configuration. This is used by the automatic serialisation framework to store the item definition in the workflow XML.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface Configurable<ConfigType>
        See Also:
        Configurable.getConfiguration()

      • getInputPortMapping

        public final Map<String,String> getInputPortMapping()
        Description copied from interface: Activity
        A processor may have different input port names to the activity or activities it contains. This map is keyed on the processor input port names with the corresponding value being the activity port name.
        Specified by:
        getInputPortMapping in interface Activity<ConfigType>
        Returns:
        mapping from processor input port names to activity input port names

      • getInputPorts

        public final Set<ActivityInputPort> getInputPorts()
        Description copied from interface: Activity
        An Activity contains a set of named input ports. Names must be unique within this set.
        Specified by:
        getInputPorts in interface Activity<ConfigType>
        Returns:
        the set of input ports for this activity

      • getOutputPortMapping

        public final Map<String,String> getOutputPortMapping()
        Description copied from interface: Activity
        Outputs of the activity may be named differently to those of the processor. This map is keyed on an activity output port name with each corresponding value being the processor output port name to which the activity output is bound.
        Specified by:
        getOutputPortMapping in interface Activity<ConfigType>
        Returns:
        mapping from activity output port name to processor output port name

        Description copied from interface: Activity
        An Activity contains a set of named output ports. As with input ports names must be unique within the set.

      • addOutput

        protected void addOutput(String portName,
                         int portDepth,
                         int granularDepth)
        Creates and adds a new output port with the provided properties.
        Parameters:
        portName - - the name of the port to be created.
        portDepth - - the depth of the port to be created
        granularDepth - - the granular depth of the port to be created
        mimeTypes - - a List of String representations of the MIME type this port will emit as outputs.
        See Also:
        removeOutputs()

      • addOutput

        protected void addOutput(String portName,
                         int portDepth)
        Convenience method, creates a new output port with depth and granular depth both set to the value for depth, i.e. no streaming behaviour.

        Parameters:
        portName -
        portDepth -
        See Also:
        removeOutputs()

      • configurePorts

        protected void configurePorts(ActivityPortsDefinitionBean configBean)

        Simplifies configuring the Activity input and output ports if its ConfigType is an implementation of ActivityPortsDefinitionBean

        For an Activity that has ports that are defined dynamically it is natural that is ConfigType will not implement this interface.

        Parameters:
        configBean -
